page.title: 13Finavon Castle
page.content: Finavon Castle,now a picturesque ruin, stands on the banks of the Lemno,close by the junction of the Lemno and the River South Esk.The castle lies East of the A94 about ten kilometres North of Forfar.You can visit this interesting ruin by seeking permission from the local estate.All that is visible of the castle from the road is the tall shattered tower built in 1593.The original castle was built by the Linsays in the Fourteenth Century.The castle collapsed in 1712 probably because the walls were undermined by the Lemno.Since then it has remained a ruin.In 1952 Doctor Simpson,a reknowned archaeologist,supervised a major excavation of the ruins and many interesting items of pottery,glassware and two sets of draughts-boards were recovered.
